Package com.jalios.jcmsplugin.categoryrights

Class CategoryRightsManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jalios.jcmsplugin.categoryrights.CategoryRightsManager
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.jalios.util.JPropertiesListener
    public class CategoryRightsManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements com.jalios.util.JPropertiesListener
    Propagate category rights to publication.

    Le comportement fonctionnel est le suivant : la propriété suivante : jcmsplugin.categoryrights.cat-ids du fichier webapp.prop définit une liste d'identifiants de catégories. Ces catégories définissent un ensemble (en prenant également les catégories qui en héritent) de catégories pour lesquelles, si un contenu est catégorisé dans au moins une catégorie de cet ensemble, pour qu'un membre voit le contenu, il faut qu'il puisse voir au moins une catégorie de cet ensemble. Cette classe est un singleton appelé dans RightPlicy, c'est également un storeListener initialisé dans JcmsInit.initStoreListener pour modifier les index lors des modifications sur les publications ou les categories ou les membres.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static java.lang.String AXIS_PROP
      The property defining Categories (Categories's id) should be used in Category Rights checks
      static java.lang.String CATEGORY_EXTRA_DATA_PROPAGATE_RIGHTS
      The property defining the Category extradata in which CRP policy can be enabled or not for a category
      static java.lang.String CATEGORY_EXTRA_DATA_PUBLISH_TYPES
      The property defining the Category extradata in which types authorized for creation are specified
      static java.lang.String CATEGORY_PROPAGATE_RIGHTS_ACL_RESOURCE
      The ACL resource granting rights to modifiy the propagate rights extradata on a category a user can manage.
      static java.lang.String TYPES_PROP
      The property defining Publication types (classname) which should be protected by Category Rights

      • init

        public void init()
        This method has to be called each time the "jcmsplugin.categoryrights.cat-ids" property is changed. For the moment, it is called only in the constructor, but might be called if the property comes in the administration area.

      • addToReadControlledCatSet

        public void addToReadControlledCatSet​(com.jalios.jcms.Category cat)
        Add specified category and all it descendent to the internal set of categories which are being controlled for "legacy" (pre CRP3) READ right control.

        INTERNAL API, do not used outside internal code of CategoryRightPlugin.

        Parameters:
        cat - a Category to add (with its descendant) accept null (which is ignored)
        Since:
        3.0.3 / CRP-43

      • removeFromReadControlledCatSet

        public void removeFromReadControlledCatSet​(com.jalios.jcms.Category cat)
        Remove the specified category and all its descendent to the the internal set of categories which are being controlled for "legacy" (pre CRP3) behavior.

        However, skip any descendant (and sub) if it is explicitel specified in controlled category

        INTERNAL API, do not used outside internal code of CategoryRightPlugin.

        Parameters:
        cat - a Category to remove (with its uncontrolled descendant) accept null (which is ignored)
        Since:
        3.0.3 / CRP-43

      • isCategoryAxis

        public boolean isCategoryAxis​(com.jalios.jcms.Category cat)
        Check if the specified category is one of the category axis specified in properties for legacy READ right control.
        Parameters:
        cat - any category (null accepted)
        Returns:
        true if category is one of the category axis specified in CRP property, false if category is null or is not one of the axis specified in properties
        Since:
        3.0.3 / CRP-43

      • getAxisCatSet

        public java.util.Set<com.jalios.jcms.Category> getAxisCatSet()
        Retrieve the Set of category configured in properties for legacy READ right control.

        It DOES NOT include the descendant categories, and DOES NOT include category using CRP3 behavior.

        Returns:
        a Set of category, never return null. Return an INTERNAL SET, do not modify!
        Since:
        3.0.3 / CRP-43

      • initClassSet

        public boolean initClassSet()
        Read the types that must be check by category right
        Returns:
        true if the configuration has changed, false if no modification was performed

      • checkRights

        public boolean checkRights​(boolean isAuthorized,
                           com.jalios.jcms.Publication pub,
                           com.jalios.jcms.Member mbr)
        Check if the publication can be read by the given member using CategoriesRights. This method is called in RightPolicy.canBeReadBy(pub, ..). The scope of publication for wich this Policy has to be used is defined in RightPolicy.java .
        Parameters:
        isAuthorized - the internal authorization right performed by JPlatform core before CRP gets invoked
        pub - the publication for which right are being checked
        mbr - the member trying to access the publication
        Returns:
        true if publication can be read by member, false otherwise

      • isControlledCategory

        public boolean isControlledCategory​(com.jalios.jcms.Category categoryPublication)
        Check if propagation of READ rights is enabled for the specified category or any of its parent.

        This methods verify that the specified category match at least one the following condition :

        • it is one of the category axis configured in the plugin properties, or any of its descendants, cf CategoryRightsUtils.isPropagateReadRightsEnabled(Category)
        • propagation of right was explicited enabled on the category or any of its ancestor, using corresponding option (extradata), cf CategoryRightsUtils.isPropagateRightsEnabled(Category)
        Parameters:
        categoryPublication -
        Returns:
        true if category is controlled by this plugin policy, false otherwise
        Since:
        CRP-24

      • clearPublicationBS

        public void clearPublicationBS​(com.jalios.jcms.Publication pub)
        Clear the BitSet associated with the given Publication. Must be called each time the publication is modified or when deleted. The new bitSet will be computed again the next time it is used.
        Parameters:
        pub - the publication of which to remove the BitSet.

      • clearPublicationsBS

        public void clearPublicationsBS​(java.util.Set<com.jalios.jcms.Publication> publicationSet)
        Clear the BitSet associated with the given Publications.
        Parameters:
        publicationSet - a set of Publication

      • clearAllPublicationBS

        public void clearAllPublicationBS()
        Clear the BitSet associated with ALL Publications (both for JStore and JcmsDB).

      • clearAllDBPublicationBS

        public void clearAllDBPublicationBS()
        Clear the BitSet associated with ALL JcmsDB Publications.

      • clearMemberBS

        public void clearMemberBS​(com.jalios.jcms.Member member)
        Clear the BitSet associated with the given Member. Must be called each time the member is modified or deleted.
        Parameters:
        member - the Member of which to clear the BitSet.

      • clearAllMembersAndGroupBS

        public void clearAllMembersAndGroupBS()
        Clear the BitSet associated with ALL Members, DBMembers and Group. Must be called each time the group tree is modified.
